description: The Mongolian government issued a travel advisory not to visit the "region where the outbreak began" (Wuhan) as of January 22, 2020.

description: Mongolia is enforcing that "all airline passengers to the United States ages two years and older must provide a negative COVID-19 viral test taken within three calendar days of travel starting January 26.  Alternatively, travelers to the U.S. may provide documentation from a licensed health care provider of having recovered from COVID-19 in the 90 days preceding travel."

description: On March 9, 2020, the Mongolian government decided to extend the suspension of flights between three cities, Ulaanbataar, Ulan-Ude, and Irkutsk, from March 11 to March 28. UPDATE: The suspension of flights between these cities was supposed to last until March 11, but has been extended to March 28.

description: On March 10, the Mongolian government decided to suspend foot and auto traffic between the capital and all aimags until March 16.

description: On November 12, the Mongolian government is enforcing a lockdown on all citizens "to stop local transmission of COVID-19". "All citizens have been asked to stay home and leave only to buy food and essentials."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On November 12, the Mongolian government is enforcing a lockdown on all citizens "to stop local transmission of COVID-19". "All citizens have been asked to stay home and leave only to buy food and essentials." UPDATE: The original lockdown was set to last until December 1, it has been extended to December 11"
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On December 21, 2020, the Mongolian government "announced that a state of “all-out-preparedness” and associated lockdown measures would be reimposed in Ulaanbaatar beginning at 0600 on December 23 and continuing until at least 0600 on January 6."
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On December 21, 2020, the Mongolian government "announced that a state of “all-out-preparedness” and associated lockdown measures would be reimposed in Ulaanbaatar beginning at 0600 on December 23 and continuing until at least 0600 on January 11." description: On February 1, the Mongolian government landed its first chartered repatriation flight carrying Mongolian citizens from Wuhan, China.
type_text: The Mongolian government decided to repatriate its citizens who desired to return by issuing chartered flights from various countries.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On February 11, municipal government of Mongolia put out an ordinance on city cleanliness, ordering citizens not to litter, spit and urinate in public places, business to keep their property clear of litter and snow, and to make restrooms available to the public.
type_text: An ordinance on cleanliness to prevent the spread of the virus.

description: On February 17, 2020, the Uvs provincial government of Mongolia decided to limit the working day to 6 hours of pregnant women and women with children under the age of 10.
type_text: The provincial government ruled to limit the working hours of pregnant women and women with children under 10.

description: On February 27, 2020, Mongolia announced the donation of 30 thousand sheep to China in solidarity.
type_text: Mongolia gave a donation to China to help its people.

description: On March 11, the Mongolian government decided to repatriate its citizens from South Korea, Japan, and other countries through 4 chartered flights.
type_text: The Mongolian government decided to repatriate its citizens who desired to return by issuing chartered flights from various countries.
